sen.e: Ichinei ISSAN (1247 - November 28, 1317) was a priest who came to Japan from Yuan (Yuan Dynasty).

sen.e: Then he learnt the principle of the Rinzai sect, did Buddhist practice in Mt. Tendo and at Joji-ji Temple, and succeeded the principle of Gyoya GANGYOKU at Aikuo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 二度の日本遠征（元寇）に失敗した元の世祖クビライは再遠征の機会をうかがうと共に、交渉によって平和裏に日本を属国とするべく使者を派遣した。
sen.e: After failing in two attempts to invade Japan (Mongol invasion attempts against Japan), Kublai (Khan), the founder of Yuan, sent a mission to Japan to make Japan its tributary nation through negotiations, although still watching for a chance to invade Japan again.
